intro: Schmidtia parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered schmidtia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the daisy family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact, cushion-like growth habit. The plant features small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, surrounded by narrow, grass-like leaves. Schmidtia parviflora is typically found in alpine and subalpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. It is a hardy species that is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant in horticulture.
